title: Don’t Count on China to Mediate in Ukraine
sub_head: Russia’s aggression has caused anxiety in Beijing, but Xi has staked too much on his ‘best friend.’
body:
Before White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan and top Chinese diplomat Yang Jiechimet in Rome on Monday, many in the West hoped that Beijing might limit its support for Russia following its invasion of Ukraine or even help end the conflict, having recently talked up its wish to see a cease-fire and its potential interest in a mediating role.
After the seven-hour meeting, the U.S. issued a three-sentence summary noting that the talks were intense and covered a range of concerns including Ukraine.
